page.title: 05CHAWTON SCHOOL
page.content: Present main building dates back to 1882. Modifications over the years. School started by C.E. charity in 1840's. Run entirely by County Council since 1955. Currently 60 pupils on roll. Taught by Mr. Alan Wilson, headteacher, Mrs. Barbara Potter and Mrs. Jean Gebbett. Official catchment area is Chawton parish plus N.W. part of Four Marks village. Pupils from Alton also choose to attend. Pypils start just before 5th. birthday and leave at end of summer term when they are eleven years old. Most transfer to Amery Hill Comprehensive School in Alton.
